intro: Eremolimon, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, often fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees, adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. They have deep root systems that allow them to survive in harsh, dry conditions. Eremolimon species are native to regions of southern Africa and are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological resilience.
